TownHouse Galleria
8.2 Excellent
Based on 52 reviews

Not worth it. Comparing with Townhouse Duomo, the service was not as good as Townhouse Duomo. The room was in poor maintenance, so not over 7 stars.

It was so disappointing. 1. No water kettle in the room 2. Bathroom rubbish was broken 3. Makeup class parts were loosened and wobbly 4. Air-con was on, but can't feel it, very stuffy. 5. Cable in the cable TV was broken, can't watch it. After being mixed, after a while was broken again 6. The tap in the bathtub was broken, the water didn't flow out properly. 7. Wall in bathroom was thin, quite noisy. 8. Curtain was broken too, one side cannot be closed Overall, the room 205 should have been blocked for maintenance. But because we only stayed for one night and we went for soccer game, was too tired to require for room change. Really regretted move from Townhouse Duomo to here, should have stayed there when visiting Milan.

Show more
Alice , Hong Kong
Armani Hotel Milano
9 Excellent
Based on 94 reviews

If you are going on a shopping spree in Milan you can't do much better than the Armani hotel. although i must say some of the furnitures may need to be replaced (for instance a rug in my room was kind of dirty and it would have been nicer if they could just get that replaced) but you can't beat the service they offer.

One thing i really like is their free mini bar....i know people would probably say everything should have been covered by their high room rate except that most hotel that comes with such rate don't offer you the free mini bar. The peace of mind for having to open a bottle of soda or juice in the middle of the night beats having to buy beverages back to hotel room and its a service that i appreciated the most here. I must also stress that all their staff are nice and will go out of the way to help if it is needed.

Show more
Ka , United Kingdom
Worldhotel Cristoforo Colombo
8.5 Excellent
Based on 261 reviews

In general, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was conveniently located on Corso Buenos Aires - a long street for shopping.

It's also a 1 minute walk away from the Portia Venezia metro station and a 20 minutes walk to the Duomo. I paid for a single room, but they upgraded me to a double room. What a relief because the double room ended up being really small (so I can't imagine how tiny a single room must be). The room I stayed in was on the first floor and every so often I could hear a gentle rumbling sound. My guess is that the sound is coming from the metro line below the hotel whenever a train pulls into the station. It wasn't very loud so I was ok with it. One thing I did have a slight problem with is that the room was way too warm. There was an AC in the room and a temperature control wall unit but both were not working. I guess they had been disabled for the winter so I ended up having to open the windows to cool down the room.

Show more
Denise , Canada
NYX Milan
8.7 Excellent
Based on 105 reviews

I had problems with my air conditioner, so much noisy. They did not resolve it and the manager suggested " to open the window during the night " if I was hot.

They didn't offer me to change the room. I spent one day asking what was happening with wi fi that I could not make a phone call neither with whatsapp nor with skype. At last , from the reception , they told me that the hotel was missing that Facility. Breakfast was good but when the hotel was full, they took so much time to replace food. Agoda put a price of boking in argentinian pesos and when it was changed to dollars, the value was higher than it should have been. The hotel is well located and it has a very modern place to have drinks, with nice music.

Show more
Romina , Argentina
Uptown Palace Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 406 reviews

The hotel is modern and nice, but did not find staff to be friendly . They work like Roberts . There was this divice in the lobby where it gives information about Resturant weather etc , it was not working when I asked the staff that it's not working and someone to help, without checking they kept saying just try .

Kept trying it for 15 min at the end when I told them there must be something wrong with it. The staff said honestly we don't know how this device works!!! So surprising expecting customers to know about a device which the staff don't even know how it works!!!! The internet is something out of this world it's not available in the rooms . You have to go to the lobby and get a two hour voucher !!! So old fashioned . Being to cheap hotels where internet connection was available in rooms. Also asked to electrics ductor which we were told that we have to buy !!! The location is not to close to attractions .you need to do a lots of walking. The only positive is there is nearby supermarket carrefour where you can buy basic things

Show more
Maya , Oman
Glam Milano Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 426 reviews

بالرغم من أن الألوان لم تعجبني لأن في كل طابق لون مختلف للمرات تخلف عن الدور الآخر لقد سكنت في الطابق السادس في غرفة 618 وكان المنظر رائعا السنترال والفنادق ممتاز وحديث والعاملون فيه رائعون ومجتهدون بمعنى الكلمة.

لقد سعدت كثيرا في هذا الفندق وقضيت فيه 3 ليالي . The Hotel is great with a very nice breakfast choices n nice but limited choices for halal food in the dinner.Its getting crowded when its opened especially for weekend but there is tasty food for everybody. I strongly recommended this hotel to Arabs travellers n families with children n the room sizes r very good. Thanks again to Glam n to its wonderful Staffs from the security guyz, the professional team at the receptiion n the wonderful team at the Restaurant n for the housekeeping ladies who professionaly clean the rooms in silence

Show more
NASSER , Oman
IH Hotels Milano Ambasciatori
7.9 Very good
Based on 326 reviews

The hotel is located in Galleria del corso. Here are the good points first: 1) It is very central and a few steps you're in the stretch of a few minutes away to Duomo, La Scala, Via Vittorio Emmanuel, Via Dante, etc.

its 15 minutes walk to Sforza Castle thus location is best! 2) wifi internet is free and reliable 3) staff are courteous and helpful 4) rooms and baths are relatively big considering this is Europe 5) and In general, the hotel is clean and tidy. However, there are a few things that will need improvement. 1) It takes too long waiting for the lift. There is only 1 lift working in the lobby so people have to wait a long time for the lift service. 2) the drain in the bathroom was clogged she I checked in, But the staff fixed it the next morning when I complained 3) the walls in the room were vandalised and left an ugly site which should be repainted 4) safe is not easy to use 5) my room was on the 1st, it was very noisy as I can hear people's voices from the other room which appears to be a stock room / office, likewise, noise from the street is also audible. So, here... with all the good and bad, its really up to you what your priorities are. If you need a fancy hotel, this is not for you. But if you want a locations that is unbeatable, this can be a good compromise! Go for it.

Show more
Catherine , Philippines
Starhotels E.c.ho.
8.6 Excellent
Based on 350 reviews

hotel location is very near termini. you can see "starhotel" signs upon exiting at the correct end of termini, where the bus terminal & taxis are.

rooms are very small. complimentary wifi is only available at the reception area. will need to pay on top of the room rate if you wish to have wifi in the room. breakfast had the same variety everyday. needed to pay for the room tax upon check-out. would be great if this was properly highlighted during booking. overall service was alright and perhaps the staff could smile & greet more, rather than just staring at you. first city in italy & makes one wonder if italians are not friendly (unless tipped?) expected more coming from a good 4-star hotel based on the price paid.

Show more
Angela , Singapore
The Square Milano Duomo
8.7 Excellent
Based on 118 reviews

The reception staff were general impolite and did not fulfill most of my requests although i booked two rooms for two adults and two kids for 6 nights.

The restaurant staff were mostly friendly and especially i want to mention there was a staff who asked us if we would like to have coffee or hot chocolate although we entered into the breakfast restaurant 15 mins before opening.

Show more
man , Hong Kong
Rosa Grand Milano - Starhotels Collezione
8.1 Excellent
Based on 226 reviews

The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the Duomo area. This makes shopping very convenient.

There is also a nice gelato place at the side entrance of the hotel. We were only our honeymoon and were upgraded to the deluxe room. The room looks newly renovated and was reasonably sized. The service of the Concierge and Bell Boys were really good. The only down side during our 2 nights of stay was that wi fi was only available in the hotel lobby and limited to 30mins per login and the bad service we received at the breakfast area. It was a Sun morning when we went for our breakfast at around 930am but the restaurant was very crowded and we needed to wait for a while before being given our table. But when we reached our table, the plates and utensils were not cleared. There was no one taking the initiatives to help us clear the table even though we have been standing there for a long while. And when we approach one of the waiter, he brushed us off with his rude attitude by saying 'WHAT"! Despite us asking him to help clear the table, he ignored us and went off. It was only after about 10 mins of waiting before another waiter came over to help clear the table. Im not sure if it was due to the restaurant being under staffed on a sun morning but their customer service definitely wasn't up to standard. We actually came back 2 days later to stay for one more night in milan before our trip back. We were given the Superior room this time round which was much smaller and looks older. Things were pretty ok until the night when we went to the bar to order a drink. It was over here where my perception of the hotel changed from good to bad. We had a very unpleasant experience with the waiter from the bar who was very rude to us. As we don’t understand italian, i think he was actually scolding us in italian. Anyway, the conclusion i got was that the customer service of their F&B staff is really bad which unfortunately painted a bad picture for the whole hotel.

Show more
Chek , Singapore
Starhotels Anderson
8.5 Excellent
Based on 577 reviews

The stay itself was nice. However, unlike described, they dont have their own parking at the site. It has eiter parkings on the street, or someone from garage where you dont know would come to pick your car up and bring it back upon your check out.

We forgot some stuff in the car, and it was not possible to get it until check out. Overall reception staff performance was very good and we were satisfied with the service. The restaurants of their recommendation is also very good and exceeded the expectation. I was happy that we went to the hotel recommended restaurant and not the google recommended ones.

Show more
Philip , Switzerland
NH Collection Milano President
8.2 Excellent
Based on 212 reviews

pros 1) 10 mins walk from shopping street (we went there 2 times a day when our stuff got too much to carry along!) 2) got a complimentary upgrade which has rooms overlooking part of the duomo 3) comfortable beds cons 1) mixed service - upon reaching the hotel, neither did the porter nor any hotel staff offered to help with our luggages (in fact the porter was standing behind the glass door keeping himself warm!).

- at check in, there was only 1 staff attending to the morning crowd. she did not take time to explain the facilities of the hotels eg. where breakfast was, breakfast timing, etc. neither did she confirmed our rooms have been paid for via agoda already. - she was attending to us in between her phone call to someone else. - when we made an enquiry, she made us wait for a long time and appeared we were bothering her. - in the evening, we spoke with a very lovely young lady at the reception. she was lovely and recommended some great local restaurants and romantic areas to explore around the hotel. - check out was relatively painless though. 2) connecting room door was unlocked we got a connecting room and the door in between the rooms was unlocked. saw a chambermaid outside our room and told her to help us lock it. she told it is okay to leave it unlocked. no it is not okay for us! she showed us that it is ok by opening the door and the guest in the other room got a shocked! he was not okay with the unlocked door too! chambermaid said she will get the door locked but did not do it. we had to call the reception after a while to get someone else to come lock it. it was done within 2 mins.

Show more
WEE , Singapore
Dei Cavalieri Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 197 reviews

Had some trouble finding the place as we took the train to reach the hotel however once we found it getting around was a breeze.

Walking distance to major attractions was such a nice way to spend your vacation where u can take your time and enjoy all the different sights the city has to present. Not to mention the nice winter weather (im from singapore where its hot and humid summer all year round so pls dont feel im weird when i said i like winter)

Show more
Brice , Singapore
Hotel Principe di Savoia - Dorchester Collection
9 Excellent
Based on 79 reviews

This was my 10th stay at Principe Di Savoia Hotel. It belongs to a chain called "Dorchester Collection", which cares a lot about the service and installations/facilities provided by the hotel.

I travel at least 3 times per year and Milan is one of the few cities in the world where I do not considered experimenting another hotel. There is almost nothing we can complain when staying there. The service/staff is prestative and competent. All Concierges are well informed and with good tips about all subjects. Food wonderful ... do not miss breakfast. It worths to pay a visit to the fitness center, spa, sauna and swimming pool on the last floor. Limousine service to the shopping area (via Montenapoleone and surroundings) is a must. The only suggestions are: more flexibility regarding guests late check-out necessities and reviewing rates for internet access and parking at the hotel.

Show more
Lauro , Brazil
Grand Visconti Palace Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 179 reviews

My wife and I were in Milan for two days coming from Venice by train. The place is located closer to Duomo.

By Metro it takes around 7 minutes and then Hotel is 10 minutes walk from the Metro station. Place is in a quite neighbourhood. We found the quality of the rooms could have been better. We stayed in room 445 and we could observe water sippage marks on the roof corner. There was plaster peeling off on one side of the room. Over all the room was very dull and the fact that there was marks of water sipping through the room in one corner and also had incidence of moulds and fungus. It was not a very pleasant experience. Since we were in Milan for only two days on our check in we did not spend much time inspecting the room. We noticed this in our return in the evening at 11.30 pm. Since we were exhausted we did not bother to request a change of room. During the night we could also hear sounds of flushing from adjacent rooms and also from rooms above us. We could also hear sound of water gushing down the drain. On our check in the Hotel Staff told us, we are upgrading you to a Superior room, "you will see the difference". It appeared after our stay that he meant otherwise. For swimming pool they charge extra, it was not included in our room tariff. We had booked inclusive breakfast. Breakfast spread was acceptable and the staff tending breakfast were very warm and supportive. Overall I believe at the price we paid we could have experience.

Show more
Anand , India
Room Mate Giulia
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 48 reviews

I stayed at a different Room Mate (Room Mate Luca in Florence) hotel prior to staying here (this Room Mate Giulia in Milan) and I have to say, it was 300% better than the former! The decoration was amazing - a modern retro, I was so pleased.

So comforting. The staffs are the friendliest I've met. The location is perfect (next to Piazza del Duomo and train station. Also all the high street shopping you need is all around you)! The breakfast spread is great, and the breakfast team are also friendly and efficient. Love Love Love!

Show more
Mohd , Malaysia
Baglioni Hotel Carlton – The Leading Hotels of the World
8.8 Excellent
Based on 55 reviews

Wonderful stay in a very well run hotel. Room, a Junior Suite, was very good, decent size with good furniture and fittings and a nice wardrobe area.

The only very minor criticism was that the shower (rainfall) was over the bath, I would have preferred a separate shower cubicle for a room at this level but otherwise the room was very comfortable. The location is superb, right in the middle of some of the best shopping in the world and within walking distance of all the sights. The staff were all very friendly and well trained, and just made the whole experience that much nicer. If anyone is looking for a proper 5* hotel in Milan I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Baglioni.

Show more
Carl , United Kingdom
Ramada Plaza Milano Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 280 reviews

the hotel is like a 'ghost town'....there is only one restaurant in the evening and nobody (that we could see) ever eats there! we had a 'suite' .

....balcony/terrace was a very large concrete area with no chairs or table...just a vast open space of concrete! the room was good but the bathroom was minute....only 1 person could really fit in...due to design and door opening inwards. we had twin beds as i was with my daughter....really uncomfortable ...'caesars palace' it isn't ....more like travel lodge in the uk (on a bad day)! breakfast not impressive.....told if a wanted croissants without marmalade filling and i would have to wait until the whole tray had been eaten ....before bringing any plain ones out (even though they had them in the 'kitchen'.....great customer service!! on the plus side the coffee maker is great with lots of different coffee pods to choose from and the shuttle is good if you want to go to milan central station...to get a train to lake como etc! you definitely could not spend the evening here....but it is near the metro...and you can get to the dumo in 10 minutes ish!! stayed march 2012, travelled with family

Show more
julia , United Kingdom
Hotel Berna
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 454 reviews

The room was spacious and comfortable. When we arrived the reception staff warmly welcomed us and gave us tip about good restaurant nearby (they also explained nicely the next day about exploring the city).

Spent a lot of time resting in the hotel because it was the middle of our long trip and did not disappointed. The only downside is the main pillow is hard, but they gave 2 small pillows which wasn't as hard. Wifi was super fast and continuous (some of other hotels we stayed have slow wifi and disconnected all the times), no buffer on youtube. We got the annex building which is located across the main building and the security is tight noone other than guests and staffs are alowed entry so we felt very safe. Overall great hotel.

Show more
Angelina , Indonesia
Starhotels Business Palace
8.2 Excellent
Based on 267 reviews

This hotel is located outside of the city centre but that's ok because this is just 3-5 minutes away from the Metro.

Duomo Station is approximately 7 stations away, and it takes 20-25 minutes to get to Centrale FS Station. The room was okay, comfy bed and clean bathroom. You need to bring toiletries though because what they offer is quite limited. The breakfast was okay. It's the same menu every day but I don't mind because I'm content with croissant, bacon and eggs. I just wish the bacon's crispier. The wifi is free and valid for 24 hours. But there's also an option to pay for a faster connection. All in all, I'm quite happy with my stay.

Show more
Bloomingdale , Philippines
Mandarin Oriental Milan
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 186 reviews

Sina De La Ville
7.9 Very good
Based on 54 reviews

I've stayed in a few hotels across north and southern italy, and Hotel De La Ville is one of the better ones.

Location is great - just 5 minutes walk from the city centre (where the Duomo of Milano is). Attentive staff. Wifi access was good in the room and more important it's free, something not all hotels in Italy provide without extra charge (or have good wifi reception inside rooms). It's a little pricey but we consider it reasonable given its proximity to Milan's shopping belt. If and when I return to Milan, Hotel De La Ville will be my choice again.

Show more
Jun , Singapore
Hotel Bolzano
7.2 Very good
Based on 381 reviews

Good location and staff performance and thats about it. The hallway on the ground level stunk of the lobby toilette.

The rooms had very linty sheets and the beds and pillow were very uncomfortable. The mattress wasn't placed properly on the bed so it kept moving if you moved a tiny bit. The internet was expensive for 5 euros for 24 hours straight (if didn't book at the hotel directly, wifi is not free). Doesn't matter if you log in or out, its only good for 24 hours, literally. The worst thing was it was slow so I felt conned about having to pay 5 euros and not getting what i paid for. The bathrooms were clean but the shower itself wasn't. It was grimy, yellowy. The shower head was very dirty and I couldn't even stand showering in it so I have to use other room's shower (my family members' room). Spend a bit more on your next stay in Milan and skip this hotel.

Show more
Angelyca , Philippines
Hotel Garda
7.8 Very good
Based on 156 reviews

I must say that I was first attracted to this hotel because of it's no pet policy. I even wrote an email to clarify and I was happy it was confirmed.

I did this because a few websites that I visited give different reviews. Hence, with the confirmation, I was able to rest my minds. I should say the hotel location is very strategic as it is near to Metro Station (Centrale Stazione is only about 2-3 minutes away) For Muslims, look no further as this hotel is within walking distance to a Halal Cafe called King Kebab. If you are not particular and not looking for any branded stuff like Prada, LV and the likes, there are street shops near the hotel. What I noticed that souvenirs are cheaper at these shops than souvenirs shops along Duomo. As we go on a F&E, we rely on the information given by the hotel staff for assistance. We were directed to a local travel agent called Zani Viaggi and managed to visit Foxtown & Lake Como. The Front Office Personnel are very warmth, one particular staff (I should have asked for his name - the guy with the beard; I hope he knew I'm talking about him) took the initiative to ask if we managed to go to places of interest that we had wanted to go. On our last day, we decided to try the Malpensa Airport Shuttle Bus which took us from Central Station to Malpensa Airport in about 40-45 minutes. It costs us Euro7.50/pax and we never regretted our decision to take the shuttle bus instead of the train. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends who are going to Milan for a holiday.

Sadly I only stayed for 2 nights - it will be longer next time. The first person I met was Fabrizio who was a brilliant old time barman/waiter he welcomed me and seeing I was tired from travelling sat me down outside and brought me my first red wine.

After that I actually registered and was given a choice of rooms but only needed to see the first as it was ideal. The room was spotless and very welcoming. The lady behind reception was a member of the family and could not be more helpful in providing me with excellent recommendations for restaurants and local sites to visit and actually marked them on a complementary map. These recommendations were better than I anticipated. To the front of the hotel is a fairy small seating area which was very comfortable and pleasant to sit and smoke. Leaving the hotel and turning left there is an excellent restaurant - The Top Hat - which, besides authentic Italian food also provides real American food which my US friends said was very good. After my US friends had left about midnight on the first night I spent 2 hours drinking and chatting with the family who own the hotel who told fascinating stories about the area and the history. The hotel had a superb collection of art and bric a brac to look at. As an Englishman the main thing is the breakfast - it was a huge selection of continental meats, cheese plus all the usual cereals etc. As I wanted to live the Italian life I did not want a Full English but was surprised to find that there was an excellent selection of home made preserves. The last person I met was Sami - the night porter who could not do enough to help - even making a pot of tea at 1.30 am! Overall I had a wonderful stay and recommend this place wholeheartedly I was genuinely sad to leave and as they have parking on site and are dog friendly I will return.

It's right across the Central Station where you can easily hop in and out trains and metros that connect all attraction points of Milan and its surrounding suburbs. Bathroom's size is just perfect (compare to most places in Italy). Kitchen is stocked up with decent dining ware should you want to bother yourself with cooking meals on your vacation. More about Milan

Milan is often referred to as Italy’s second city, famous for its catwalks, unparalleled shopping, and trend-setting entertainment. The city has its fair share of historic cathedrals and museums, but Milan is always on the short-list of those on the cutting edge of the fashion industry.

The Duomo, a gothic cathedral that took centuries to build, looms over a few of the most luxurious hotels in Milan. This is the world's fourth-biggest church, and it deserves all of the attention it demands. Construction on the Duomo began in the 14th century in what is now the Centro Storico, or historic center.

The Milan shopping scene is north of the Duomo. Four major commercial avenues converge on what many would say is the world's best shopping district. Chic designer flagship stores and boutiques are widespread, and fashion exhibitions are staged on local catwalks throughout the year.

Like much of Italy, Milan is a city rich in world-class art such as the Last Supper of Leonardo da Vinci.

Hotels in Milan fill quickly most times of the year, so booking early is essential.

Milan Malpensa Airport is the major international gateway in Milan, but the city also operates the regional hub, Linate Airport. A popular alternative for those traveling through Europe is to take the high-speed train to Stazione Centrale, north of the city center.

There’s much more to see and learn about Milan, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

I think compared to Asian 4 stars hotel, Da Vinci is still below standard and the price is way too high. The apartments offered by Airbnb is such better than a room at Da Vinci's and cheaper. The location is another issue for tourists. It's 15 minutes to the Metro and no taxi around unless we call the cab. Although it is 30 mins to Melpansa airport, it costs 90 euros by taxi. After that I actually registered and was given a choice of rooms but only needed to see the first as it was ideal. The room was spotless and very welcoming. The lady behind reception was a member of the family and could not be more helpful in providing me with excellent recommendations for restaurants and local sites to visit and actually marked them on a complementary map. These recommendations were better than I anticipated. To the front of the hotel is a fairy small seating area which was very comfortable and pleasant to sit and smoke. The hotel had a superb collection of art and bric a brac to look at. Show more Tai ,Malaysia Discover the neighborhoods of Milan City Center 420 hotels Stazione Centrale 371 hotels Navigli 320 hotels Porta Venezia 279 hotels Centro Brera 251 hotels Citta Studi 247 hotels Fiera Milano City 214 hotels Porta Vittoria 206 hotels Sempione 197 hotels Pero 188 hotels Stazione Garibaldi 158 hotels Ripamonti Corvetto 145 hotels San Siro 143 hotels Porta Romana 126 hotels Certosa 117 hotels Niguarda 94 hotels Barona 86 hotels Bicocca 80 hotels Lorenteggio 70 hotels Gorla 53 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Milan 2219 Guest Houses in Milan 384 Serviced Apartments in Milan 76 Hostels in Milan 39 More about Milan Milan is often referred to as Italy’s second city, famous for its catwalks, unparalleled shopping, and trend-setting entertainment. The city has its fair share of historic cathedrals and museums, but Milan is always on the short-list of those on the cutting edge of the fashion industry. The Duomo, a gothic cathedral that took centuries to build, looms over a few of the most luxurious hotels in Milan. This is the world's fourth-biggest church, and it deserves all of the attention it demands. Construction on the Duomo began in the 14th century in what is now the Centro Storico, or historic center. The Milan shopping scene is north of the Duomo. Four major commercial avenues converge on what many would say is the world's best shopping district. Chic designer flagship stores and boutiques are widespread, and fashion exhibitions are staged on local catwalks throughout the year. Like much of Italy, Milan is a city rich in world-class art such as the Last Supper of Leonardo da Vinci . Hotels in Milan fill quickly most times of the year, so booking early is essential. Milan Malpensa Airport is the major international gateway in Milan, but the city also operates the regional hub, Linate Airport . A popular alternative for those traveling through Europe is to take the high-speed train to Stazione Centrale, north of the city center. There’s much more to see and learn about Milan, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
